intro: Anneslia socorrensis, commonly known as the Socorro anneslia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socorro in the Revillagigedo archipelago. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant grows in rocky coastal habitats and is adapted to the island's unique environmental conditions. It is a rare and endemic species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements. Due to its restricted range and habitat vulnerability, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
